data.text: @dumbassgenius Yeah it's still very bad. South Korea & Vietnam's daily counts are the most believable tho. Just keep an eye on their data. U won't miss the boat:)
@dumbassgenius You look into the Pfizer docs that came out? Might make you feel differently
@dumbassgenius Right. We know the vaccines & boosters cut hospitalisations & deaths way way down. Hence why I think vaccine mandates ought to remain in place.
@wjm_1964 Hong Kong's vax rate is similar to ours. Could be better. Is it fully reopened with masks optional? If so, too soon, obv.

@dumbassgenius Either that or since Omicron is just that contagious, even the highest vaccinated nations could still have millions of people getting infected. (Imagine if 95% of the US were vaccinated. That leaves 5% not. 5% of 330mn = 16.5mn)
@nguyenivy True. But at least they have very good vax percentages. (I'm not aware of their re-opening policies. Guessing they're too wide open.)
@wjm_1964 Just looked. Deaths are 0.7% of new cases, but that will go up. Its death rate to date is 1/11th of the US's death rate.
